text: I saw Draft Day yesterday and i liked it. I was surprised to see Chi McBride, Puff Daddy, Terry Crews in this. I also saw former Browns players Jim Brown and Bernie Kosar in it at the end. When Kevin Costner was driving through downtown Cleveland, i could tell that the movie was filmed in Cleveland because i saw some buildings in the area that look familiar. When Kevin stopped at a gas station in the flats downtown, i know that gas station because i've driven by there before. Sometimes when movie directors do a movie, they say that the movie is in a certain city but the movie would be filmed in another city. That happens a lot but director Ivan Reitman definitely filmed this in Cleveland. I wonder what made Ivan wanna do a movie about the Browns. Maybe he felt sorry for them because they're always losing and he wanted to give the Browns fans something to be happy about LOL.
author: Keith Witcher

text: Beating the Computer in Madden is more satisfying than this movie. Draft Day relies mostly on graphic novel-esque split screen scenes of a seemingly never ending phone call.  The only thing they got right is that the Jag's front office is who I would assume you as a GM would call last minute to get yourself out of a jam because they just have to be even more incompetent then you are, being the Jags and all.  Aside from that, the NFL reality is so exaggerated and inaccurate it becomes annoying to anyone who knows a lick about football.
author: Thomas Parsons

author: Jordan Kenney

text: I saw this movie last night and I did not care for it. I like football. Imoo, I don't understand why a movie about draft day should be made. It's like making a gunslinger movie about the characters choosing what guns they want or a movie like Fast and furious except its just the characters trying to get the best deal on the cars at a dealership, get my point? I don't care about that minutiae and I doubt a lot of people would. Draft day felt like advertisement for gmc, Chevy, windows 8, twitter, and probably had 30+ cellular phones ringing and being answered. The shameless product placement was so obvious it was cringeworthy. The movie, to me, reflected how materialistic society has become and how our priorities can get way out of hand (ei. The main character, Sonny, refusing to pay his respects to his father by spreading his ashes in the center of the football field and being disrespectful to his mom, which there was never any conclusive resolution of and he never made things right on). Anyway, I didn't care for the movie, but some people probably will. Interested to see if anyone agrees. This was just my take. Not forcing anyone to feel the same way.

text: This movie was dumb. The GM first trades 3 #1's for a 1st round pick. The owner wants the hot QB. Then the GM changes his mind and picks his original player using his 1st round pick. Then he trades 3 #2's to get the 5th round pick. Other teams think the QB is damaged goods because the GM passed on him at #1 and so he is still available. The GM then calls the team he traded his #1's to, the team who really wants that QB, and tells them he wants his 3 #1's back plus a punt returner or he'll take the QB as his #5 pick and they won't get him with their #6 pick. They go for the deal and he gets his #1's back and everybody congratulates him on what a genius he is.  Dumb. Here's why:  1. The owner is happy but why? He didn't get his QB. He got the guy he didn't want. 2. The GM effectively cost his team 3 #2's to get the punt returner. Bad trade. 3. Had the GM done nothing and just picked the guy they ended up with using their #7 pick, they'd still be where they ended up (except for the punt returner) AND they'd have their 3 #2 picks as well.  Really dumb movie.
author: The Artful Dodger

text: Watched the Film and Read all the comments so i will start with:...rugby vrs american football, they are 2 differint games. in rugby you cant pass the ball forward, you have to drive it forward which makes it a lot more physical, yet they dont wear armor like they are feudal vikings. American football maybe good , i have no fucking idea, cause i would have to study for 3 years to know the rules. Anyway i only came to say , this film was fucking horse shit. who gives a fuck what kids in school get picked....realy. This is the first time i have watched a film about american sports that i hated. and another point, the "corp" that runs these school teams, there on the take, there non profit non tax paying orginization making billions from school kids who play sports. fucked up system ? nuff said.
